chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens
Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury

result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called: 9:16 am
Includes 15CF373, 15CF379, 15CM29.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence:
Defendant appears in custody and with Atty Robin Kennedy;

PRELIMINARY HEARING on 15CF379:
Waiver of Prelim. filed.  
Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information filed.  Reading Waived.
Plea: NOT GUILTY
Bond:  Continued

PLEA HEARING ON 15CF373 and 15CF379:
VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to: 
15CF373:
Ct. 1 (DC)>>DRI.
Ct. 2 (Resisting an Officer)>>DRI.
COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA: 
15CF379:
Ct. 1 (Battery by Prisoners)>>NO CONTEST.
Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
15CF379:
Ct. 1 (Battery by Prisoners)>> Sentence W/H- 3 years probation, concurrent to 15CM29. CONDITIONS: Counseling as recommended by agent, Good faith effort to maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 10 hours Community Service a week, Take medications as prescribed, Court Costs.  COURT finds 121 days credit. 


SENTENCING HEARING ON REVOCATION ON 15CM29:
Ct. 1 (DC)>> 90 days MCJ w/Huber privileges for work/school/treatment/job search/Community Service or a combination, to run consecutive to Ct 2 and concurrent to 15CF379.

Ct. 2 (BJ)>> 9 months MCJ w/Huber privileges for work/school/treatment/job search/Community Service or a combination, to run consecutive to Ct 1 and concurrent to 15CF379.

COURT FINDS 121 days Credit.

Case Called: 9:05am. INCLUDES 15CF373, 15CF379. Clerk: Denise.  State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence. Defendant appears in custody and by Atty Robin Kennedy. Matter set for Prelims on both file. State files Amended Criminal Complaint on 15CF373. W/R. Plea: NOT GUILTY on 14CF373. Crt proceeds with Prelim on 15CF379.  Atty Kennedy raises competency of Defendant. Crt finds probable cause on 15CF379. COURT considers request of competency evaluation. COURT accepts and orders evaluation to be commenced on Defendant. Atty Kennedy to prepare Order- BR 1 will sign it. COURT tolls time limits of prelim on 15CF379. DATES: Set further dates. CC: BR 5. Adjourned: 9:08am.
INCLUDES 15CF373 & 15CF379   Shall not consume alcohol. Absolute sobriety from alcohol.
